Title: Junior Consultant - Data Scientist (Intern)
Description:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonché supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.

La Lighthouse è il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalità e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Data Engineering, progettazione delle informazioni e Data visualization. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacità di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:


Analizzare e integrare fonti di dati;
Progettare database per scopi analitici;
Progettare KPI e framework di calcolo più efficienti;
Analizzare processi aziendali e progettare modelli di supporto analitico;
Analizzare, progettare e implementare modelli di reportistica e dashboard di monitoraggio;
Implementare soluzioni analitiche, supportare il lancio e gestire la manutenzione delle applicazioni.


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:


Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica;
Hai sviluppato la capacità di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati;
Hai sviluppato Interesse per la business intelligence/data analytics;
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL; la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformità del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità.


Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
About the Company - Mediobanca is the leading investment bank in Italy. Internationally our footprint includes branches in London, Madrid, Paris and New York. Since Mediobanca was founded in 1946, we have been helping Italian businesses growth with premier advisory services and a complete range of credit solutions, offering customized services and the most sophisticated solutions on financial markets, from advisory to lending, capital markets to specialty finance. With our long-standing presence, solid market position, distinctive specialization, excellent service quality and professionals of the finest calibre, Mediobanca’s corporate customers know they can count on the excellence and exclusivity that have earned us an impeccable reputation over time. Our clients include some of the leading business groups in Italy, plus a significant number of mid-size corporates, to whom we have devoted particular attention over the past ten years. Increasing focus is also being placed on our international clients, for both their cross-border needs and domestic operations. We have introduced new products and targeted new clients in order to meet the challenges posed by today's highly competitive financial markets. As ever it is our clients, along with our professionals and the soundness of our finances, which represent the core values of Mediobanca.



About the Role - Mediobanca is seeking a Data Scientist with a strong statistical background eager to work on the enhancement of the value of financial business related data by applying data-driven methodologies. More specifically, the candidate will:



  • collect, examine, and analyze large amounts of financial data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities useful for informed investment strategies and business decisions to be taken;
  • utilize advanced statistical methods to develop models for the implementation of business cases;
  • create customized tools and algorithms to automate complex processes, enhance efficiency and provide innovative solutions for business needs;
  • supervise and actively participate to the implementation of the Group's AI data platform;
  • proactively introduce the necessary governance for the implementation of AI use cases.



Responsibilities - In a challenging yet collaborative work environment, the candidate will contribute to oversee several initiatives to move the data agenda forward and will be part of a broader transformation program at Group level without losing sight of regulatory requirements.



Qualifications - We are looking for motivated professionals with 2-4 years of work experience and a Bachelor or Master Degree in quantitative or business related subjects, such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science.



Required Skills



  • strong knowledge of statistical methodologies, modeling techniques, and machine learning algorithms;
  • advanced programming skills, particularly in languages such as Python, R and one query language like SQL;
  • understanding of fundamental principles of financial activities and capital markets;
  • ability to work both autonomously and in team;
  • excellent communication skills and ability to clearly present analysis results to non-technical stakeholders;
  • strong intellectual curiosity and willingness to explore new approaches;
  • a brief experience on NLP and Generative AI will be considered as a plus;
  • proficiency in both written and spoken Italian and English languages.


Diversity & Inclusion are core values for the Mediobanca Group. All applications are welcome; we value age, background, ability, personal orientation and gender expression diversity.

Title: Data Scientist Intern (Extracurricular Internship/Tirocinio extracurriculare)
Description:
Empatica

Empatica is a full-stack digital healthcare company that is forever changing the way health is monitored and new treatments are developed through our AI platform, digital biomarkers, and state-of-the-art medical wearables. Our customers range from some of the world's largest institutions (such as NASA, Harvard University, and top-tier pharmaceutical companies, to name a few) to individual users who message us every day and tell us how our products have changed their lives.

If you want to join a fast-paced growth environment and do meaningful work that can impact the world, then keep reading.

About The Role

We are seeking a motivated, pragmatic, and goal-oriented Data Scientist Intern to join our team. This role is an exciting opportunity for a passionate individual to gain hands-on experience in data collection and data analysis of physiological and behavioral data collected with wearable devices, contributing to the foundational aspects of data science initiatives. You will work in close contact with our Data Science team, which develops all the digital biomarkers that will be embedded in our products bringing them from their initial research stage to a clinically validated stage.

As a Data Scientist intern, your responsibilities will include:


Support Data Science team members on data collection designs
Assist in organizing and coordinating data collection activities across various projects
Perform quality checks on collected data to ensure accuracy and completeness
Work closely with the team to troubleshoot and resolve data collection issues
Document data collection processes, protocols, and best practices
Refactor, clean, and organize new and/or existing datasets
Process data to make them available for algorithm development
Support Data Science team members on foundational aspects of algorithm development (e.g., exploratory data analysis, feature analysis)



Requirements


A minimum of an MSc Degree in Electrical, Biomedical, or Electronic Engineering (or
equivalent). Biomedical Engineering/Bioengineering is preferred
High proficiency in speaking, reading, and writing both English and technical English
Have experience in data collection with medical devices, or a strong interest and desire to learn about them
Familiarity with Python and/or MATLAB
Experience in clinical/research studies and monitoring experimental protocols is a plus
Coursework and/or experience with machine learning is a plus
Have resilience, a get-things-done attitude, and an innate desire to do great work
Have a hands-on approach with mobile applications and electronic devices (in our


case medical).


Fun and easy to work with
Have a passion for Empatica's products and mission



Benefits

🧠 Be part of a fast-growth company in one of the hottest areas of tech

💰 Compensation

🥗 Free healthy lunch every day

🕰️ Flexible working hours

👀 Much more...
Show more

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Department

At Sappi, our Digital Transformation team thrives on tackling business challenges by harnessing the power of analytics, AI, and user-centric design. Driven by a passionate group of data and analytics experts, we optimise processes, uncover valuable insights, and empower proactive decision-making to drive success. Join us as we innovate and transform the future

Role and Responsibilities

In this role you will report to the Head of Data Analytics (based in Brussels).

You will be responsible for:

Collaborating with various teams to analyze key business problems and develop innovative ML solutions, continuously delivering valuable output.
Designing and implementing scalable machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions into daily operations.
Establishing testing, monitoring and continuous improvement of ML processes.
Making relevant, detailed, well-structured data available for analytics
Applying data science best practices focusing on data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation. Enable rapid prototyping and evaluation.

Required Qualifications

Experience developing and optimizing scalable machine learning solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS).
Strong expertise in ML operations and coding with Python; knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, adaptable to both technical and business audiences.
Intellectual curiosity and a degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering).
Fluent in English.

Traveling:

It is expected to have some traveling (up to 10%) to the locations of group.

What we offer:

An excellent opportunity to work, learn & grow with us. With our culture of learning & development, you can access thousands of online trainings
A multi-cultural & international environment to share and collaborate with colleagues from more than 68 nationalities in 31 locations globally.
A unique opportunity to join a global wood fibre solution company. We are constantly innovating toward a circular economy working to achieve our sustainability goals & reduce our carbon foot print.
Friendly atmosphere and team-work oriented culture
Work-life balance
Training opportunities

All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neurodiversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G, we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




😍 Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist AI
Description:
Mission context




The Tribe AI’s objective is to leverage data science use cases to create value for the bank. The use cases can come from any department of the Bank, for instance: Robotics, Compliance, Client service center,Marketing, Sales, ...

We are looking for an external consultant who can help us to use new generative AI tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to improve our employee productivity and efficiency in our standard activities. The consultant will work with different business users from different parts of the bank, such as marketing, sales, and back office, and with different profiles, such as managers, project managers, sales people, etc.




Function description




Design and create the prompts that can elicit the best responses from the generative AI tools, using prompt engineering techniques and best practices
Understand the business needs: Identify the use cases, the business need and scenarios where our generative AI tools can add value and solve problems
Test and evaluate the quality and accuracy of the generative AI tools' outputs, using appropriate metrics and feedback mechanisms
Train and coach the business users on how to use the
generative AI tools e􀆯ectively and responsibly and begin to set in place a prompt academy
Document and communicate the results and learnings of the project




Language requirements




Dutch Fluent
French Fluent
English Fluent




Education

You have at least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, such as statistics, mathematics, engineering (a PhD is considered an advantage) or MBA.
Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial knowledge of prompt engineering technics are also encouraged to apply.




Required experience/ knowledge

You have at least 3 years of relevant experience in Data Science and

Analytics.




Technical experience




Deep knowledge of generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT, Mistral, Llama, etc and Microsoft Office CoPilot, and their underlying principles of large language models
Strong experience in advanced prompt engineering, including designing, creating, testing, and optimizing prompts for different tasks and domains
Microsoft Office Copilot + Copilot ChatGPT, Gemini, ...




Business experience




Business understanding and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and vice versa
Communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to explain complex concepts and results in a clear and concise manner
Language skills, with fluency in French, Dutch, and English preferable Financial sector




Soft skills

Team player
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Good Communication and Influencing skills
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
Thinks out of the box outside existing processes and frameworks.
Works with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company’s success
Constructive by being open to the changes and to other’s opinions, ideas and feedback

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist to support our financial analytics and machine learning initiatives in Brussels. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will apply data science, AI, and predictive modeling to enhance financial decision-making, risk assessment, and customer insights.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning models for financial forecasting, risk analysis, and fraud detection.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on large financial datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources, ensuring quality and consistency.
Build and optimize predictive models, including time-series forecasting, credit scoring, and anomaly detection.
Automate data pipelines and improve data workflows for real-time analytics.
Collaborate with finance, risk, compliance, and IT teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Create clear visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or R for data science and machine learning.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of financial statistics, risk modeling, and time-series analysis.
Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for deploying and monitoring ML models.

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated and able to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail, especially regarding financial data accuracy.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, insurance, fintech).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Experience in credit risk modeling, fraud detection, and algorithmic trading.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or email me directly at adam@kodastaff.com

Show more

Title: AI/NLP/ML Expert (hybrid, Brussels / Belgium)
Description:
We are seeking an AI/NLP/ML Expert to join our Client’s team in Brussels, Belgium.

The candidate will work on cutting-edge projects focusing on Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and data analytics architecture while collaborating closely with cross-disciplinary teams in an agile environment.

Eligibility


Must be a citizen of an EU member country.


Responsibilities


Collect business requirements and analyze advanced AI solutions or assess existing ML, data mining, and business intelligence tools.
Design and specify user-friendly, optimal presentation interfaces to enhance usability and user experience.
Create data models that address specific problem statements effectively.
Contribute to and implement analytics architecture and solution stack, addressing performance, physical design, and capacity dimensions.
Write clear, structured documentation and collaborate with other project teams to resolve cross-project dependencies.
Work with data stewards and IT stakeholders to define data rules, quality controls, and integrity checks.
Build automated anomaly detection systems and monitor their performance.
Conduct data mining using state-of-the-art methods while processing, cleansing, and verifying data integrity.
Design and analyze IT architectures for NLP, ML, and AI solutions, ensuring consistency and alignment with master/meta-data management principles.
Evaluate data architecture for accuracy, consistency, and reasonableness.


Qualifications

Education:


Master’s degree in a relevant field.


Skills And Experience


Natural Language Processing (NLP): Strong understanding of lifecycle management and proficiency in NLP techniques and systems.
ML/AI Expertise: Extensive experience with machine learning techniques (k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, etc.), large language models, and predictive/prescriptive analytics.
Corpus-Based Linguistics: Hands-on experience with alignment models and classification methods.
Data Analytics: Expertise in analyzing large datasets, including data lakes and unstructured/non-structured databases.
Modelling: Proficiency in tools and techniques such as BPMN, UML, and entity-relationship diagrams.


Tools And Technologies


Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, and PERL.
Extensive knowledge of SQL (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL).
Familiarity with business intelligence tools (Tableau, Qlik, SAS, SAP, GoodData).
Experience with ETL processes and tools such as Talend Open Studio or SAS.
Tools for big data analytics and building scalable data stores.
Knowledge of Graph Databases for specific solution designs.


Architectural Skills


Expertise in designing scalable architectures and implementing modern data stores.
Knowledge of recommendation systems, trends/anomalies detection, plagiarism detection, sentiment analysis, topic detection, and social media processing.


Agile Approach


Strong understanding of Agile development.
Cross-functional collaboration with teams using Scrum/Kanban methodologies.


Desirable Knowledge


Familiarity with architectural design principles for predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Experience with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras).
Advanced experience with Large Language Models and graph-based systems.


Why Apply?


Contribute to high-impact projects tackling advanced AI/ML and NLP-driven solutions.
Challenge your expertise across multiple fields of data, AI, and advanced analytics within a multicultural and international environment.
Collaborate with a talented team driving innovation in AI for an esteemed organization.


Additional Information

If you meet the outlined requirements and are ready for your next challenge, we want to hear from you.

Skills: r,machine learning (ml),sap,data analytics,tableau,artificial intelligence,talend open studio,hadoop,keras,mongodb,natural language processing (nlp),qlik,gooddata,perl,nlp,nosql db,sas,tensorflow,python,pytorch,sql,ml
Show more

We are looking for a Data scientist to support FME data flows related to asset management. The role involves processing, analyzing, and managing large datasets using FME software and SQL. Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
The mission of Predictive Analytics team within Marketing and Communication department is to develop, deploy and support usage of AI models to increase the reach and relevance of the campaigns.




As ML Engineer you will manage the data science ecosystem of the team to build and run our models (Domino Data Science Platform), setup data preparation pipelines, assure and monitor the quality of data sources used to generate indicators, run and monitor the performance of the models.




Function description

The Predictive Analytics team is looking for a Machine Learning (DevOps) Engineer with a proven track record on developing and deploying data science models in python environment as well as experience in data engineering.




You are part of data science team and will work on the following:




Manage the execution and quality assurance of the monthly production run from data preparation, scoring and validation of different AI models and analytical indicators. Improve the automation of this process to make it more efficient
Maintain and improve the existing python programs for collecting and validating data from different sources, for building, scoring, and performance monitoring of AI models of the team (e.g. python version upgrades)
Interface between data scientists and IT to support the usage of the Domino Data Science Platform, the AI building blocks and the evolution of the python environment.
Assist data scientist by helping them identify and install the correct dependencies in their environment, best practices for code quality, continuous improvement and automation
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering), automatic refit of the data science models
Explore new ways of combining the available tools of the bank (AI building blocks from Tribe AI) to unlock new capabilities for building AI products and supporting the data scientists.
Work with a team of motivated data scientists who are eager to learn, collaborate and share expertise.




Telework

50% on-site, 50% telework




Language requirements

English

You have fluent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Dutch/French

Fluent/Good level of Dutch (French is a plus)

Education

You have a degree in a quantitative field (e.g Master in computer sciences)

Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial experience in data science, ML DevOps are also encouraged to apply.




Required experience / knowledge

You have at least 3 years of relevant experience.




Mandatory

Strong expertise in software development in Python and Python data science packages (pandas, sklearn)
Git
bash
SQL
Experience in MLOps / DevOps




preferable

SAS
Domino Data Science Platform
Django
software testing
experience in containerization (docker)
experience in Cloud environments




Business experience

preferable

Marketing and communication




Soft skills

Team player, good communication and presentation skills
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Result driven
Analytical and problem solving mindset
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Passionate about continuous improvement

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?

In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.

As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.

Responsibilities

Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository


Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standards.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.


Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions


Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.


Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence


Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.


Education


Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.


Professional Experience


Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Technical Skills


Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.


Languages


Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.
Show more
HTML:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?

In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.

As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.

Responsibilities

Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository

  • Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standards.
  • Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.

Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions

  • Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
  • Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
  • Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.

Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence

  • Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
  • Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.

Education

  • Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
  • A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.

Professional Experience

  • Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
  • Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Technical Skills

  • Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
  • Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
  • Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
  • Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
  • Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
  • Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
  • Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
  • Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
  • Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
  • Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.

Languages

  • Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge tech with cinematic magic.

Location: Remote in Europe

Salary up to $90,000




You will build and deploy AI models that power groundbreaking filmmaking tools. Collaborate globally, code with precision, and drive innovation through data-driven testing.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: AI/NLP/ML Expert (hybrid, Brussels / Belgium)
Description:
Company Description

We Cook iT is an international software house that delivers software development to its corporate customers by providing highly skilled, communicative IT professionals to build their customized products through outsourcing, nearshoring and turn-key projects’ solutions.

How do we differentiate ourselves? By investing in the professional growth and personal care of our software developers. We provide them with a premium service so that they can do the same for our customers.

Our talented team holds software engineers and sales experts, spread across offices in Europe and South America, and we represent a go-getting and driven company who aims to be an inspiring software house, knowing our future relies on IT.

We Cook iT stand for growth, support, dynamic, companionship and communication. Our head office is located in Portugal in the heart of Lisbon (Avenida da Liberdade) and we work mainly for the European market.

Job Description

We are urgently seeking an AI/NLP/ML Expert to join our Client’s team in Brussels, Belgium.

The candidate will work on cutting-edge projects focusing onNatural Language Processing (NLP),Machine Learning (ML), and data analytics architecture while collaborating closely with cross-disciplinary teams in an agile environment.

Eligibility:


Must be acitizen of an EU member country.


Responsibilities


Collect business requirements and analyze advanced AI solutions or assess existingML,data mining, andbusiness intelligencetools.
Design and specify user-friendly, optimalpresentation interfacesto enhance usability and user experience.
Create data models that address specific problem statements effectively.
Contribute to and implementanalytics architecture and solution stack, addressingperformance,physical design, andcapacity dimensions.
Write clear, structured documentation and collaborate with other project teams to resolve cross-project dependencies.
Work withdata stewardsand IT stakeholders to define data rules, quality controls, and integrity checks.
Build automated anomaly detection systems and monitor their performance.
Conduct data mining usingstate-of-the-art methodswhile processing, cleansing, and verifying data integrity.
Design and analyze IT architectures forNLP,ML, andAIsolutions, ensuring consistency and alignment withmaster/meta-data managementprinciples.
Evaluatedata architecturefor accuracy, consistency, and reasonableness.


Qualifications

Mandatory Requirements

Education:


Master’s degree in a relevant field.


Skills and Experience:


Natural Language Processing (NLP):Strong understanding of lifecycle management and proficiency in NLP techniques and systems.
ML/AI Expertise:Extensive experience with machine learning techniques (k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, etc.), large language models, and predictive/prescriptive analytics.
Corpus-Based Linguistics:Hands-on experience with alignment models and classification methods.
Data Analytics:Expertise in analyzing large datasets, including data lakes and unstructured/non-structured databases.
Modelling:Proficiency in tools and techniques such asBPMN,UML, and entity-relationship diagrams.


Tools and Technologies:


Proficiency in programming languages likePython,R, andPERL.
Extensive knowledge of SQL (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL).
Familiarity withbusiness intelligence tools(Tableau, Qlik, SAS, SAP, GoodData).
Experience withETL processes and toolssuch as Talend Open Studio or SAS.
Tools for big data analytics and building scalable data stores.
Knowledge ofGraph Databasesfor specific solution designs.


Architectural Skills:


Expertise indesigning scalable architecturesand implementingmodern data stores.
Knowledge ofrecommendation systems,trends/anomalies detection, plagiarism detection,sentiment analysis, topic detection, and social media processing.


Agile Approach:


Strong understanding of Agile development.
Cross-functional collaboration with teams using Scrum/Kanban methodologies.


Desirable Knowledge:


Familiarity witharchitectural design principlesfor predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Experience with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras).
Advanced experience withLarge Language Modelsandgraph-based systems.


Why Apply?


Contribute to high-impact projects tackling advanced AI/ML and NLP-driven solutions.
Challenge your expertise across multiple fields of data, AI, and advanced analytics within a multicultural and international environment.
Collaborate with a talented team driving innovation in AI for an esteemed organization.


Additional Information

If you meet the outlined requirements and are ready for your next challenge, we want to hear from you.

If you meet the outlined requirements and are ready for your next challenge, we want to hear from you.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ALTEN Belgium is a leading player in the fields of Engineering, Life Sciences and Information Technology, where people and innovation are at the heart of everything we do. In our open and dynamic organization, we empower our ambitious employees to unlock their full potential and thrive professionally.




We achieve this by offering them exciting projects and continuous development opportunities through the ALTEN Academy and our knowledge-sharing events. Our employees are part of a vast network of expertise, extending even internationally. This way, we foster individual growth while delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients.




Context

In this role, you’ll help lead innovation in machine-learning techniques for driving and vehicle monitoring. You’ll be responsible for creating a machine-learning model that monitors and analyses time series data in real-time. As part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team, you'll collaborate with researchers and engineers to integrate and optimize the model. If you’re a collaborative problem-solver with a strong background in time series and deep learning, and you're passionate about motorsport and automotive technology, this is the perfect opportunity for you to make an impact.




Expertise

Expertise in Machine Learning and Deep Learning, including familiarity with classical algorithms
Knowledge of foundation models, including large vision models and multi-modal models
Experience with time series analysis (experience with large real-time data is a plus)
(Preferred) Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and deploying deep neural networks in practical applications
(Preferred) Experience in integrating algorithms and conducting testing in real-world settings (e.g., embedded devices and cloud infrastructure)




Technical

Proficient in Python, with additional knowledge of C++ and MATLAB/Simulink
Strong expertise in PyTorch (experience with PyTorch Forecasting and TensorRT is a plus)
Familiarity with Python libraries such as Pandas and Scikit-learn (experience with SKTime and Darts is a bonus)
Skilled in Linux, Docker, and Git
Experienced in working with Linux environments and High-Performance Computing (HPC), preferably with AWS and Azure
(Optional) Experience with embedded architecture, specifically Nvidia Jetson




Tasks

Design, assess, and refine algorithms from the time series literature
Keep up-to-date with the latest developments in foundation models and time series analysis
Implement algorithms and manage the code repository
Work closely with researchers and engineers to train, test, and evaluate the model
Develop and support demonstrations with real systems and prepare for field tests
Present findings during regular project meetings and prepare results for publication




If you are interested, don't hesitate to apply!




Note: We are only hiring candidates authorized to work in Belgium without needing visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Expert (AI/NLP/ML)
Description:
📢 We are looking for an Artificial Intelligence Expert (AI/NLP/ML)!

We are seeking a highly skilled Artificial Intelligence Expert specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and AI-driven solutions using Large Language Models (LLMs) for HR and Document Management applications. This role is part of the Architect Office (AO), which oversees and coordinates technical and business architecture-related activities. The position is remote, based in Europe (far-site).

📍 Location: Europe (Remote – Far-site)

📆 Start Date: Immediate

💼 Experience: Expertise in AI/ML/NLP solutions and cloud-based architectures

What Will You Do?

✅ Develop and maintain AI-powered software applications in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and Artificial Intelligence (AI).

✅ Design and optimize machine learning systems and deep learning architectures.

✅ Integrate AI/ML solutions into existing products and processes in collaboration with cross-functional teams.

✅ Architect and implement AI solutions, ensuring compliance with master- and meta-data management principles.

✅ Conduct data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation to enhance AI performance.

✅ Stay up-to-date with AI/ML advancements, adopting state-of-the-art algorithms and technologies.

✅ Manage and maintain AI solutions deployed on SaaS platforms (AWS, Azure).

✅ Document architectural blueprints and align business requirements with AI-driven capabilities.

The candidate will report to the Architect Office (AO) and project managers, following SAFe methodology and sprint-based planning.

Requirements:

Requirements & Skills:

✨ Proven ability to develop Large Language Models (LLMs), text embeddings, tokenization, and vectorization.

✨ Strong expertise in Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning architectures.

✨ Hands-on experience with Python, Java, Containers (Docker/Kubernetes), and Cloud AI services (AWS, Azure).

✨ Deep understanding of NLP systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies.

✨ Knowledge of quality assurance and control for machine translation (MT), including testing methodologies and evaluation metrics (BLEU scores and similar).

✨ Strong problem-solving, analytical, and technical writing skills.

✨ Ability to conduct proof of concepts (PoC) efficiently and effectively.

✨ Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred Qualifications & Certifications:

✅ AWS Certified Machine Learning / Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate.

✅ AWS Certified Data Analytics / Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate.

✅ AWS Certified Solutions Architect / Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert.

Additional Requirements for Large International Organizations:

🌍 Ability to integrate into an international, multicultural environment and work in multilingual settings.

🤝 Strong team player with experience working on large-scale projects.

📝 High degree of discretion and integrity, as the managed applications contain confidential and personal data.

🗣 Fluent English (C1/C2) is mandatory; French (B1/B2) is an advantage.

Why Join Us?

🚀 Work on cutting-edge AI/NLP/ML solutions in a highly innovative and technical environment.

🌍 Remote opportunity within a highly collaborative and multicultural team.

💡 Be part of an international transformation program, driving AI-powered solutions for HR and Document Management.

💼 Competitive salary, career growth opportunities, and involvement in AI-driven digital transformation projects.

📩 Apply now or send your resume to jobs@sapindex.es and be part of the AI revolution! 🚀

Title: Expert in AI/NLP/ML
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an Expert in AI/NLP/ML fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either in the company's premises or on site at customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Design and implementation of AI solutions in close collaboration with team management and AI technical lead;
  • Propose or support adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets;
  • Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management;
  • Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions


Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 5 years' of specific expertise in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP;
  • Minimum 3 years' of specific expertise in cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications;
  • Minimum 3 years' of specific expertise in the command of Python and R proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot;
  • Minimum 2 years' of specific expertise in version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow);
  • Minimum 2 years' of specific expertise in Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal);
  • Minimum 1 year of specific expertise in Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing;
  • Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques;
  • Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud);
  • Experience with cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models;
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation;
  • Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL would be considered as an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language, along with a solid understanding of French


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference: (18286/02/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com)is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using integrated state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents..

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with extensive experience in running and scaling models on public cloud platforms. The successful candidate will join our team to optimize, implement, and maintain our organization’s cloud-based systems.


Responsibilities:**
Design, develop, and deploy modular models on cloud-based systems.
Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions, adhering to company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly review existing models and systems, making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modify and improve existing systems.
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Technical Skills:**
Proven work experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Preferred: GCP certifications.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant training and/or certifications as a Google Cloud Engineer.
Proficiency in Google Compute Engine, including creating, managing, and scaling virtual machines (VMs) to meet diverse workload requirements.
Expertise in designing solution architecture on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aligning with project-specific needs and objectives.
Strong grasp of programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, and Node.js.
Expertise in programming frameworks and libraries specific to GCP, such as Google Cloud SDK, Cloud Client Libraries, and Cloud APIs.
Understanding of serverless computing, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and event-driven architectures for developing scalable and efficient applications on GCP.
Knowledge of containers and infrastructure automation tools.
Proficiency in tools including Ansible, Docker, Windows PowerShell, and Linux/Unix.
Expertise in Google Cloud Storage.
Familiarity with other GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Software Security Skills:**
Expertise in securing applications and data on Google Cloud, including:
Configuring Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control resource access.
Implementing network security measures such as firewall rules and encryption.
Monitoring and logging security events using tools like Stackdriver Logging.
Ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
Securing containers and Kubernetes clusters.
Complying with security standards and regulations.
Developing incident response plans.
Automating security checks and vulnerability scanning.
Following secure development practices.


These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.


Coding and Scripting Skills**
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
Testing Skills**


The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess


Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.


**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**


Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines


An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours


Self-learning abilities
Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
Naturally curious & always a step ahead
Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.


, ING Bank

Title: Data Scientist - ML
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.







Key Responsibilities:

Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As a collaborator in the Machine Learning team, you ensure the different predictive models and algorithms are running qualitatively and on time in the production environment also called the model factory. The mission of the machine learning engineer is key because this role makes the bridge between the products delivered by the Data Science team and the usage of the business.




The machine learning engineer will also cover some more technical missions as for example web scraping, POC’s concerning AI & Generative AI (in order to ensure a move to production for those POC’s).




The Machine Learning team is responsible for the quality of the models and as a consequence of the value created by the models that will be used by all the internal clients.




Your responsibilities:

Deploy large scale machine learning models and other scripts into production environment (in cloud and on-premise environments)
Review, optimize and simplify the code to ensure quality and reusability
Monitor the quality of input variables and the performances of the models’ outputs.
Contribute to parts of the ML pipeline, such as data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate models into production.
Monitor model performance and updates models as needed
Solve well-defined machine learning problems and may work on smaller projects or parts of larger projects.
Apply existing algorithms and techniques to specific business problems




Specific expertise:

Expert understanding of git, experience with CI/CD pipelines;
Proficiency at Python and solid knowledge of at least one deep learning framework such as TensorFlow / Keras or PyTorch is a must.
Good knowledge of computational infrastructure;
Basic knowledge of Terraform;
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, general deep learning, predictive modelling and Generative AI in order to be able to challenge the inputs and the outputs produced by the Data Science team
Understanding of Google Cloud Platform, ML Ops principles and software development tools/best practices;
Expertise in Data Ingestion / Processing and Modelling: you are able to express complex data needs and understand data quality-cleansing processes & methods
Extensive Corporate Data Knowledge: aware of critical company business processes and underlying data, you are able to challenge data quality
Fluency in SQL for writing efficient queries on large datasets
Good knowledge of Linux operating system
Ability to write robust code in Python, R and Java
Good to have: good knowledge of networking, multiprocessing, parallel computing and real-time computations;
Should be able to challenge the inputs and outputs of AI and Gen AI products as well as the way it was built.




Your profile:

Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics) or equivalent work experience. with 2-5 years of experience in machine learning or related fields
Proficient in key machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Analytical thinking and self-learning spirit
Strong programming and data analytics skills
Able to work and collaborate transversally
Good communication and presentation skills (vulgarisation)
Collaboration skills (with other data scientists, data engineers and other teams)
Capacity to influence and engage, assertiveness and being diplomatic
Customer-oriented and pragmatic
Stress resistant
Fluent English and fluent French or Dutch




Our offer:

You will make the difference in this highly innovative vibe. As a result, you will develop your full potential by working with highly skilled colleagues and through continuous training. Moreover, you can count on a highly competitive and versatile compensation (market competitive salary, company car or legal mobility budget, homeworking and net allowance, performance bonus, meal vouchers) and benefits package.




Inspired? Please send us your resume and we will rapidly get back to you to invite you for further interviews.

Show more
