Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

Who We Are

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.

In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

What You’ll Do


You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists
You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning
You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).


About You


You hold a Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.
You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
You have fully professional proficiency in English


Travel: 0%

Start date: ASAP

Our offer

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What’s important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE’s hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.

N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.

Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant’s personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.


Show more
HTML:
N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

Who We Are

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.

In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

What You’ll Do

  • You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists
  • You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
  • You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
  • You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
  • You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning
  • You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).

About You

  • You hold a Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
  • You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
  • You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
  • You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
  • You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
  • You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
  • You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
  • You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.
  • You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
  • You have fully professional proficiency in English

Travel: 0%

Start date: ASAP

Our offer

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What’s important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE’s hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.

N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.

Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant’s personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

Title: ML Engineer - MLOps, Inference
Description:
Want to scale AI Agents through innovative ML infrastructure?




A pioneering AI company is looking for an experienced Engineer to revolutionize how their agent technology is deployed and served. While others follow conventional paths, they're creating new approaches to agent-specific serving challenges.




Short term, you'll focus on cloud deployment and performance optimization, enhancing their current infrastructure. Long term, you'll help design and build proprietary frameworks that challenge the status quo of model serving.




What You'll Do:

Architect and improve cloud-based deployment systems
Create efficient solutions for concurrent model serving
Lead the transition from Open Source and third-party tools to custom frameworks
Drive innovation in model compression and performance
Design new approaches to large-scale model deployment




You Should Have:

Advanced degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong background in MLOps or Model Inference
Experience scaling AI models in production
Python expertise and interest in systems programming
Track record of solving complex deployment challenges




Bonus Points For:

LLM model serving such as vLLM or similar
Building custom serving solutions
Knowledge of GPU optimization
Experience with large language models
Background in high-performance computing




You'll join a world-class team pushing the boundaries of what's possible with AI agents. Work remotely (EU/US East Coast) or hybrid from their London office.




This role is perfect for someone who:

Enjoys tackling unprecedented technical challenges
Thinks creatively about infrastructure problems
Values practical solutions while innovating for the future
Thrives in fast-paced, research-driven environments




Compensation is highly competitive (£125,000-£250,000 basic salary), negotiable based on experience.




Ready to help define the future of AI infrastructure? Contact Marc at Techire AI to learn more. All applications will receive a response.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You’ll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!




At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken

Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)

Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?

Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig tewerk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?

Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
B.E.S. (Business & Engineering Solutions) is growing and thus welcoming new AI Research Engineer in our Automotive team.




As a AI Research Engineer at B.E.S., you will enjoy a collaborative environment where you will work closely with others in an organisation focused on innovation.




Your responsibilities:




Develop and optimize machine learning algorithms for time series data.
Stay updated on advancements in foundation models and time series analysis.
Implement, test, and maintain machine learning models and code repositories.
Collaborate with researchers and engineers in the automotive sector for model training and evaluation.
Support field tests and demonstrations with actual systems.
Integrate algorithms into embedded devices and cloud infrastructures.
Contribute to deployment and continuous integration of models in real-world environments.
Travel for collaborative work and testing between locations.




Your profile:




You have a background in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or Mathematics.
You have 3-5 years of relevant professional experience.
You have a research-driven mindset, with at least a Master’s degree (PhD preferred).
You are practical and you have a hands-on approach focused on solving real-world challenges.
You are a highly self-motivated, and skilled at juggling multiple tasks with ease. You are always eager to learn and grow.




What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills,
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge,
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances, OR a freelance contract,
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team!

Show more

Your profile:


  • You have a background in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or Mathematics.
  • You have 3-5 years of relevant professional experience.
  • You have a research-driven mindset, with at least a Master’s degree (PhD preferred).
  • You are practical and you have a hands-on approach focused on solving real-world challenges.
  • You are a highly self-motivated, and skilled at juggling multiple tasks with ease. You are always eager to learn and grow.


What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?


  • Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills,
  • Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge,
  • A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
  • A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances, OR a freelance contract,
  • A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team!

Title: AI Expert ( NLP, ML)
Description:
Hello,

We are called People More because we treat our employees with respect, but also because the projects we work on are for people and should be easy and pleasant to use. We are technological, but we look at the bigger picture :)

People More has been in existence for over three years and is an offshoot of one of the country's oldest interactive agencies - Insignia. The company is made up of people with a huge client base in the country and abroad, for whom we build projects from scratch (UX, UI, frontend, backend, mobile) or in part. We work directly for our clients and also support our partners in their own solutions. This ensures a wide range of projects and the ability to change! We work with clients all over the world.

For the project that we are working on with our foreign partner, we are looking for AI Expert (NLP / ML)

Your Duties Will Include


Developing and optimizing AI/ML and NLP models using advanced algorithms.
Deploying AI solutions in the cloud and utilizing containerization and version control.
Analyzing, modeling, and processing data, including exploration and segmentation.
Tracking new AI technologies and supporting their integration with IT systems.


Requirements That Must Be Met


At least 5 years of professional experience in AI development, including machine learning and NLP.
Proven expertise in Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.
Strong command of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as k-NN, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, and AI frameworks.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is an advantage.
Ability to adapt to evolving AI technologies and methodologies.
Hands-on experience in data preparation and cleaning for AI and machine learning models.
Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker) for AI/ML application deployment.
Knowledge of Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is a plus.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (GitHub/GitLab) and ETL tools (e.g., Data Services, Talend, etc.).
Strong technical proficiency in database design, data modeling, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Relocation to Belgium required
Very good English and Polish


What We Offer


We are open and honest and we solve problems instead of generating them.
Maybe it’s obvious, but we really respect our employees and associates. We used to be software developers, too, and we appreciate that job!
A small team
An international working environment and international projects
Private medical care
Sports card
Training courses
Hybrid work in Belgium


If you are not sure if you meet the requirements, apply—we’ll talk and give you an honest answer.

Why it’s a good idea to work with People More?


If you are not satisfied with your work or your tasks, we’ll find a way out together!
If you get bored, we will offer you a new product and new, fascinating tasks
We will work on your brand together: you will get an opportunity to attend conferences, including as a speaker, and we will help you publish in recognized magazines and online
We will facilitate your access to challenges that are usually difficult to get
At any time, you can talk directly to the board of People More—we talk your language because the company’s founders are software developers and designers!


What does the recruitment process look like?


A friendly remote initial interview
A remote technical talk
The decision to work together!


Salary

230 - 300 zł/h

contract

B2B

Location

Belgium / Brussels
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerciële B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat Betekent


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je Herkent Jezelf In De Volgende Competenties


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe ideeën helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerciële strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast Kan Je Rekenen Op


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en privé dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in België, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega’s.

What’s next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
My client is seeking AI/ML Engineers with expertise in computer vision and image processing. They are a heavily funded and ambitious AI start-up based in Abu Dhabi, UAE.




The ideal candidate will develop and optimize deep learning models / VLMs for object detection, segmentation, classification, text extraction, and fine-tuning for domain-specific applications.




My client is seeking top talent globally, ideally they are looking for candidates from tier 1 or equivalent companies and top education backgrounds.




You will be integral to developing industry-leading AI software driven by cutting-edge research. You will have the opportunity to design, implement, and deploy innovative software solutions in a fast-paced environment while working alongside ex tech-giant professionals from the likes of Amazon, Meta, Google DeepMind, McKinsey and Microsoft.




Alongside your tax-free salary you will be offered a region leading benefits package including:




A months salary to cover relocation costs for you and your family.
Education allowance for up to 3 children (private schooling).
Annual flight home for you + family.
Private healthcare for you + family.
Accommodation for a month on arrival.
Annual 25% bonus.




To discover more, apply now!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Python)
Description:
Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for machine learning and predictive analytics? Do you thrive on building models that drive real business impact, optimizing processes, and uncovering insights from complex datasets? Are you both detail-oriented and capable of seeing the bigger picture? If you’re looking to apply your ML expertise in a fast-growing and dynamic company, we want to hear from you!

At eCarsTrade, we value innovation, analytical thinking, and a results-driven mindset. In return, we offer flexibility, competitive incentives, and an environment for professional growth.




Responsibilities

Develop and maintain predictive models to estimate used car market prices, customer willingness-to-pay, supplier acceptance prices, lead time etc...
Design, implement, and maintain analytical and ML microservices using Python.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Sales, and Engineering) to identify business needs and model opportunities.
Identify and correct inaccuracies in car data (e.g., missing features, incorrect attributes).
Build recommendation engines to suggest optimal auction strategies and vehicle pricing.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience building and deploying end-to-end ML models and analytical solutions.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects with minimal supervision.
Experience building and maintaining microservices (e.g., using Flask, FastAPI, or similar frameworks).
Strong Python coding skills, including experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, and possibly PySpark.
Deep understanding of regression, classification, time-series forecasting, and clustering methods.
Strong communication and presentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

Nice-to-Have

Experience in automotive or auction-based industries.
Experience with ML lifecycle and MLOps (model versioning, CI/CD pipelines for ML).




Please send your CV to jobs@eCarsTrade.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer | Relocation to Abu Dhabi | Highly Competitive Salary




Are you ready to push the boundaries of AI and work on cutting-edge machine learning models? We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join an elite team driving innovation in AI. This role is for those who thrive on solving complex challenges, leveraging LLMs, RAG, and Generative AI, and want to make a real impact.




Why Join Us?

✅Work on industry-defining AI solutions with a world-class team.

✅Apply cutting-edge technologies like LLMs, fine-tuning, and generative AI to real-world challenges.

✅A highly competitive, tax-free salary with exceptional benefits.

✅Full relocation to Abu Dhabi, including visa sponsorship for you and your family, educational allowance for children, private healthcare, and an extra flight home every year.

✅One-month extra salary in your first month to help you settle in.




What You’ll Do

✅ Develop and deploy ML models that power next-gen AI solutions.

✅ Work with LLMs, RAG, LangChain, Weaviate, LangGraph, LlamaIndex, and other cutting-edge ML tools.

✅ Solve real-world challenges across multiple industries using AI.

✅ Collaborate with top AI minds in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.




What We’re Looking For

✅ 5+ years of experience in Machine Learning, AI, or Data Science.

✅ Strong hands-on experience with LLMs, deep learning, and generative AI.

✅ Master’s or Ph.D. in AI, Data Science, Computer Science, or related fields.

✅ Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.

✅ Experience competing in Kaggle, ACM/ICPC, IOI/NOI, or other coding challenges is a plus!




If this sounds interesting, apply now and let’s build the future of AI together!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to work in a company with the purpose of helping patients around the world? Do you want to learn and grow every day? Do you want to change healthcare?




Lyfegen is a fast-growing health-tech company making healthcare more accessible and affordable by delivering solutions for healthcare payers and pharma to identify the right drug pricing agreements, simulate and understand the financial impacts of those agreements, and automate the management of them.




We are seeking a passionate and skilled AI Engineer. This role focuses on leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology.




We are doing things nobody has done before! Thus, creative problem solving is a must and a get-things-done mentality a definitive requirement.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.
Familiarity with databases for storing and retrieving data for AI models. (SQLAlchemy,Alembic)
Expertise in Python-based Web frameworks such as Flask, Django or FastAPI.
Research mindset by owning an AI feature/product end to end building server-side software that delivers AI inference results, aiming for reliable, scalable systems that seamlessly integrate into our products.
AI toolchain integration skills. Ability to integrate and orchestrate AI tools and libraries into cohesive, user-friendly, and performant systems.
Experience in recommendation engines is a bonus, particularly in apps involving pricing.
Strong problem-solving abilities to identify issues and evaluate solutions.
Analytical skills to implement effective AI strategies.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively with stakeholders.
Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly AI-enabled solutions.
Hands-on experience with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) on tabular data.







What we offer:

Join a company with a purposeful vision and mission.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to work in a company with the purpose of helping patients around the world? Do you want to learn and grow every day? Do you want to change healthcare?


Lyfegen is a fast-growing health-tech company making healthcare more accessible and affordable by delivering solutions for healthcare payers and pharma to identify the right drug pricing agreements, simulate and understand the financial impacts of those agreements, and automate the management of them.


We are seeking a passionate and skilled AI Engineer. This role focuses on leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology.


We are doing things nobody has done before! Thus, creative problem solving is a must and a get-things-done mentality a definitive requirement.


Your main responsibilities:

  • Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
  • Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
  • Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
  • Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
  • Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.


Who you are:

  • Machine learning and NLP expertise:
  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
  • Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
  • Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
  • Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.
  • Familiarity with databases for storing and retrieving data for AI models. (SQLAlchemy,Alembic)
  • Expertise in Python-based Web frameworks such as Flask, Django or FastAPI.
  • Research mindset by owning an AI feature/product end to end building server-side software that delivers AI inference results, aiming for reliable, scalable systems that seamlessly integrate into our products.
  • AI toolchain integration skills. Ability to integrate and orchestrate AI tools and libraries into cohesive, user-friendly, and performant systems.
  • Experience in recommendation engines is a bonus, particularly in apps involving pricing.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities to identify issues and evaluate solutions.
  • Analytical skills to implement effective AI strategies.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively with stakeholders.
  • Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly AI-enabled solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) on tabular data.



What we offer:

  • Join a company with a purposeful vision and mission.
  • Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
  • The possibility to work flexibly.
  • Become part of a team of international high performers.
  • Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

Title: Founding AI Engineer
Description:
Plain is redefining customer support for the next generation of B2B companies. We’re building the fastest, most powerful platform to help companies move beyond reactive support and build true customer relationships.

B2B customer support is undergoing a seismic shift. AI is transforming the way companies engage with customers, shifting support from a siloed function to a company-wide effort across Slack, Discord, and in-product experiences. The old way – slow, manual, and disconnected – no longer works.

Some of the world’s most forward-thinking companies – like Stytch, Sanity, and Fly.io – trust Plain to unify all customer interactions, enable faster team collaboration, and supercharge their workflows with AI.

What you’ll do

We’re in a rare position. We’ve already built a deeply scalable, lightning-fast support platform that high-growth companies love. AI has been at the core of our product for a while now – but now, we want to take it to the next level. We have the opportunity to define how AI powers customer support at every level, from automating workflows to deeply understanding customer needs.

This is where you come in.

We’re looking for a sharp, fast-moving, and customer-obsessed Founding AI Engineer to accelerate our AI ambitions. This is a rare chance to shape the AI strategy of an early-stage, high-impact product and help build a category-defining company.

Engineering at Plain isn’t about just moving tickets. It’s about solving complex, high-impact problems – owning them end-to-end, from prototype to production.

In this role, you will:


Define our AI infrastructure and play a key role in shaping our AI strategy.
Own and ship AI-powered features from concept to production.
Solve complex machine learning challenges – especially around AI accuracy, reliability, and quality – using a rigorous, truth-seeking approach.
Serve as the team’s AI expert, helping to build a world-class AI practice.
Advocate for our work externally – writing, speaking, and engaging with the broader AI community.


This is a great fit if you…


Are an experienced backend engineer who’s built AI products in the OpenAI & Anthropic era – especially text- and data-heavy AI applications.
Have AI observability experience. AI isn’t just about shipping features that sound great – it’s about knowing, conclusively, if they’re making things better.
Have a clear perspective on what makes a great AI-powered product. We want to apply AI with precision, nuance, and real impact – not as a gimmick.
Are self-driven, impact-focused, and thrive in a fast-moving, high-ownership environment.
Measure your success by user impact, not just technical elegance.
Bonus: You have a data science background that helps you fine-tune AI accuracy and quality.


This won’t be the right role if you…


Have only academic or research ML/AI experience. We need someone who’s applied AI to real products, not just explored theoretical models.
Think AI for support is just chatbots. B2B support is complex – we’re AI-powering the entire platform, not just automating conversations.
Struggle with ambiguity. We’re an early-stage startup. Things change quickly, and often, knowing what to work on is as important as the work itself.
Prioritize working with the latest tech for its own sake. We choose tools that make us productive – not what’s trendy. (Postgres is great.)
Are looking for a management role. This is a hands-on individual contributor position.
Want the perks of a big company. We offer competitive compensation for our stage, but we’re a startup – this is a different kind of opportunity.


Note: We are an equal-opportunity employer and remote-only company. At this time, we can only support hiring within Europe for this role.

Compensation Range: £75K - £130K


Show more

Title: Data Scientist Prompt Engineer
Description:
Mercier Consultancy is seeking a talented Data Scientist Prompt Engineer to join our dynamic team. As an integral part of our organization, you will leverage your expertise in data science and artificial intelligence to develop and refine prompt engineering techniques that enhance the functionality and performance of our data-driven solutions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement innovative models that meet the diverse needs of our clients while pushing the boundaries of technology. Your role will be pivotal in transforming complex data into actionable insights, and your creative input will assist in driving strategic decision-making processes. With us, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects that impact various industries, from technology and finance to healthcare and beyond.

We are looking for an external consultant who can help us to use new generative AI tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to improve our employee productivity and efficiency in our standard activities. The consultant will work with different business users from different parts of the bank, such as marketing, sales, and back office, and with different profiles, such as managers, project managers, sales people, etc.

Responsibilities


Design and create the prompts that can elicit the best responses from the generative AI tools, using prompt engineering techniques and best practices
Understand the business needs: Identify the use cases, the business need and scenarios where our generative AI tools can add value and solve problems
Test and evaluate the quality and accuracy of the generative AI tools' outputs, using appropriate metrics and feedback mechanisms
Train and coach the business users on how to use the generative AI tools effectively and responsibly and begin to set in place a prompt academy
Document and communicate the results and learnings of the project



Requirements


Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Experience with machine learning frameworks and prompt engineering techniques
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to non-technical audiences
Knowledge of data visualization tools and methodologies
You have at least a Master's degree in a quantitative discipline, such as statistics, mathematics, engineering (a PhD is considered an advantage) or MBA
Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial knowledge of prompt engineering technics are also encouraged to apply
Fluent in Dutch, French and English
Team player
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Good Communication and Influencing skills
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
Thinks out of the box outside existing processes and frameworks
Works with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company's success
Constructive by being open to the changes and to other's opinions, ideas and feedback


Benefits

Competitive Monthly Salary

Working for a worldwide multinational

50% from home - 50% from location

And more....
Show more

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Bioprocessing
Description:
The Company

At Invert, we are on a mission to dramatically reduce the dollar and time cost of using biology to manufacture ~everything. Our customers use bioprocessing to do things like: produce new therapies to combat disease, create new biomaterials to solve the environmental crisis, and manufacture essential chemicals cleanly. We provide them with tools to automate the design, execution, and analysis of all that amazing work!

The Invert team is comprised of creative and talented engineers, data scientists, biologists, and more, and we are supported by amazing investors. We value diversity and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to join our remote-first, collaborative environment.

The team

You will be joining our Data Science team, working on groundbreaking applied research solutions that not only set new industry standards but also redefine the boundaries of possibility for our customers. Your work will be at the forefront of innovation, pushing the limits of what's achievable in bioprocessing and shaping the future of our field.

The role

Mission

As a Staff Data Scientist, you will lead the development of models and algorithms. You will be responsible for selecting and applying the right models, preparing datasets, and identifying opportunities to build large foundational models specific to bioprocess data. In this role, you will contribute through hands-on work, push the scientific bar with reproducible and well-documented research, and ship models that will multiply speed and product for our customers.

Competencies


Analytical: Exceptional problem-solving skills and a deep understanding of data science methodologies
Ambitious: Intrinsically motivated, driven to succeed
Track record: Has shown leadership and vision in the bioprocess industry with published research
Communicates effectively: Ensures that the right information gets to the right people at the right time
Innovates: Constantly brings new ideas and approaches to improve bioprocess outcomes
Takes ownership: Takes accountability, prioritizes team success
Technically skilled: Proficient in time series forecasting, optimization, neural networks, feature engineering, statistical techniques, linear algebra, hybrid modelling, fluid dynamics, adaptive experimentation, bayesian methods
Technically productive: Delivers high-quality results with a focus on velocity
Trustworthy: Acts in the company’s best interests


The package


High-growth startup with impactful work
Fully remote, distributed across US and European timezones
Competitive salary, equity, and benefits
New laptop, monitor, and accessories of your choice
Frequent team off sites
Unlimited PTO


The interview process

The interview process consists of the four stages described below. Candidates are assessed between each of these stages. The hiring manager is responsible for communicating decisions and next steps throughout the process. We aim to complete all stages within two weeks.


Discovery: A 30-minute conversation with the hiring manager to determine whether there is mutual interest in moving forward.
Bioprocess and Data Science Competencies: A 60-minute deep dive technical conversation with a team data scientist to assess bioprocess and data science theory competencies.
Technical Competencies: A 90-minute working session with two employees to assess python coding competencies.
Non-Technical Competencies: Two 60-minute interviews with two different employees to assess non-technical competencies.
References and Founder Chat: Three 15-minute conversations between the hiring manager and previous colleagues to gather external input. Simultaneously, a 30-minute meet-and-greet with one or both of the founders (depending on whether they have already participated in previous interviews).
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Freelance
Description:
Rejoignez une mission stratégique et à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d'un groupe reconnu en Belgique !




Nous recherchons activement un(e) Senior Data Scientist (freelance) pour accompagner une entreprise leader en Belgique dans ses projets de transformation digitale et d’exploitation avancée des données.




Notre partenaire est un acteur clé dans le secteur de la mobilité, reconnu pour son engagement dans la durabilité, l’innovation et l'excellence de ses services.




Basé(e) dans la Région Bruxelloise, vous interviendrez sur des missions à fort impact stratégique, allant de l’analyse exploratoire des données à la mise en place de modèles prédictifs et de solutions d’intelligence artificielle, au service de la performance et de la prise de décisions.




Vos responsabilités :

Exploiter et analyser les données pour identifier des tendances et extraire des insights exploitables.
Concevoir et entraîner des modèles prédictifs et des algorithmes de machine learning pour résoudre des problèmes spécifiques du client.
Utiliser des techniques avancées de statistiques, de modélisation et de science des données pour optimiser la prise de décision.
Collaborer étroitement avec les Data Engineers et les Data Analysts pour assurer la qualité, la structuration et la visualisation des données.
Communiquer les résultats aux équipes métier à travers des rapports, des visualisations interactives et des présentations claires et synthétiques.




Votre profil :

Minimum 5 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist, avec une expertise en analyse et modélisation avancée.
Solides compétences en statistiques, mathématiques, machine learning et deep learning.
Maîtrise des langages et outils de data science : Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, SQL.
Expertise en visualisation de données avec Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly ou des outils BI.
Une connaissance des architectures cloud et big data (AWS, Azure, GCP, Spark) est un plus.
Capacité à comprendre et résoudre des problématiques complexes, avec une approche analytique et stratégique.
Excellente communication et capacité à traduire des concepts techniques en recommandations claires pour les équipes métier.
Bon niveau de français et d’anglais, permettant une collaboration efficace avec différentes parties prenantes. La connaissance du néerlandais est un atout.




Notre offre :

Une mission stratégique et à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d'un groupe reconnu en Belgique.
Un contrat freelance dans le cadre d’un projet de longue durée, à fort impact social.
Une rémunération compétitive prenant en compte le niveau d'expertise du candidat ou de la candidate.
Un travail en mode hybride, avec des possibilités de télétravail.




Cette belle opportunité vous intéresse ? N'hésitez plus à postuler car cette annonce ne tardera pas à disparaître ! Notre recherche est urgente.

Show more

  • Capacité à comprendre et résoudre des problématiques complexes, avec une approche analytique et stratégique.
  • Excellente communication et capacité à traduire des concepts techniques en recommandations claires pour les équipes métier.
  • Bon niveau de français et d’anglais, permettant une collaboration efficace avec différentes parties prenantes. La connaissance du néerlandais est un atout.


Notre offre :

  • Une mission stratégique et à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d'un groupe reconnu en Belgique.
  • Un contrat freelance dans le cadre d’un projet de longue durée, à fort impact social.
  • Une rémunération compétitive prenant en compte le niveau d'expertise du candidat ou de la candidate.
  • Un travail en mode hybride, avec des possibilités de télétravail.


Cette belle opportunité vous intéresse ? N'hésitez plus à postuler car cette annonce ne tardera pas à disparaître ! Notre recherche est urgente.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
HTML:
• At least 8 years of specific expertise in Perl, Python, Matlab, R and their NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas);
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in Large Language Model prompt engineering.;
  • At least 7 years of specific expertise in query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc and with information extraction;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in data management and analytics, including data quality, and advanced data retrieval tools;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in AWS, Azure or other cloud platforms;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in machine learning systems lifecycle

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

At Dataroots, we couple our excellent consulting services with our technical expertise to build advanced machine learning models to improve business processes across a variety of industries, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be an integral part of our in-house team of AI specialists, designing and implementing models that deliver robust, data-driven solutions for our clients.




Passionate about data, you enjoy diving deep to uncover actionable insights and develop machine learning models that enhance client operations. You’ll experiment with different approaches, while collaborating with Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists to drive the delivery of tailored, high-quality, end-to-end solutions.




You’ll also have the opportunity to mentor colleagues, share knowledge, and stay on top of industry developments through a range of initiatives we support internally.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

A deep passion for Machine Learning and a Master’s or PhD in a quantitative discipline.
Strong foundation in software design principles.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in machine learning and big data.
Expertise in machine learning and deep learning, with both a theoretical and practical grasp.
Proficiency in Python & SQL is a must; knowledge of R is an advantage.
Experience with deploying machine learning models and familiarity with MLOps practices.
At least a first experience with AWS, Azure or GCP and a solid understanding of cloud engineering and its use in Machine Learning.
Experience with ML versioning tooling.
Enthusiasm for working with large datasets and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complex technical concepts for clients.
Fluency in English and Dutch.




Don't worry if you don’t meet every requirement from the start. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! 🎉

Show more

Title: Data Scientist H/F
Description:
A propos de JEMS

Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…

Vos missions

Vous Aurez La Charge De

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist capable de trouver des solutions innovantes et robustes à l'ensemble des problématiques Data. Gourou de la donnée, vous vous amusez à faire parler les données et à les mettre au service des entreprises. Vous êtes donc à la croisée d'enjeux fonctionnels et stratégiques :


Étudier des données en possession de l’entreprise
Définir et récupérer des données pertinentes à extraire et à traiter en lien avec la production de l’entreprise, la vente ou encore liées aux données clients
Développer des algorithmes permettant d’améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblages
Élaborer des modèles prédictifs afin d’anticiper l’évolution des données et tendances relatives à l’activité de l’entreprise


Vos compétences

En tant que Data Scientist H/F vous maîtrisez :


L'architecture des bases de données décisionnelles (data warehouse)
Les mathématiques appliquées : construire des algorithmes pour améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblages
Les statistiques


Et Vous Disposez


De solides compétences en programmation informatique (Python, R…)
D'une expertise en algorithmie et gestion des bases de données (NoSQL, Cassandra…)
De la connaissance des méthodologies agiles


Votre profil

Diplômé(e) d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'une université, vous justifiez d'au minimum 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans un contexte projet Data. Rigoureux(se), proactif(ve) et autonome vous restez en veille technologique et êtes force de proposition. Vous êtes capable de prendre de la hauteur et vous adapter aux enjeux du projet.

Avantages à travailler chez JEMS


Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)
Un accompagnement personnalisé et un management de proximité pour vous proposer des évolutions de carrière
Une intégration dans des communautés techniques et de pratiques JEMS (encadrement par des experts, échanges sur les bonnes pratiques, favoriser l'innovation...)
Une entreprise reconnue "Great Place To Work"
Des évènements et séminaires inoubliables, des soirées d'agence conviviales


Mobilité

Une mobilité nationale et internationale pour vous accompagner dans vos projets de vie.

Diversité

Le Groupe JEMS porte fièrement sa valeur "Diversité" en se mobilisant pour l'inclusion et l'égalité des chances et en luttant contre toutes formes de discrimination.

Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Financial Services domain)
Description:
We’re looking for a passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join our team and dive into the exciting world of Generative AI. You’ll work on cutting-edge demos and proof of concepts (POCs), turning bold ideas into reality. The ideal candidate brings solid Back-end engineering skills and a curiosity for Generative AI development. If you’re familiar with MLOps, large language models (LLMs), or concepts like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). Experience in the Financial Services domain, particularly Banking, will be a significant advantage.




You will be exposed to a variety of tasks, including:

Develop Proof of Concepts (PoC). Test and validate new ideas
Drive implementation, optimizing and transforming data solutions to improve business outcomes
Help with offerings as a technical consultant




Responsibilities

Assist in building and testing Generative AI demos and POCs
Support the design of simple, scalable architectures for Generative AI applications
Work with team members to integrate AI components into larger systems
Use MLOps practices to help automate parts of the model development process
Follow guidance to ensure Generative AI applications are secure and meet basic governance standards
Help deploy AI applications on cloud platforms or on-premise setups with team support
Adapt to a fast-paced environment with evolving project needs
Keep up with AI trends and apply them to projects with guidance




Requirements

4+ years of experience in IT with at least 2-3 years of experience in Machine Learning
Solid backend engineering skills, particularly with Python (e.g., Django, Flask, or FastAPI); knowledge of other languages like Java or Go is a bonus
Experience in pre-sales, opportunity processing
Basic experience with databases or tools like vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate, Faiss)
Familiarity with AI frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge of RAG or AI application basics (security, governance, etc.).
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) or on-premise setups
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to handle shifting priorities with Support team
Experience with client-facing roles
Excellent presentation and demonstration skills
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, or a related field
Upper-Intermediate level of English




Would be a plus

Contributions to open-source projects or experience with tools like Airflow or Spark
Familiarity with containers (e.g., Docker) or orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes)
Experience in the Banking and Financial Services domain
Exposure to prompt engineering or fine-tuning LLMs
Knowledge of other languages like Java or Go

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
AI Research Engineer




👉 About Scalian




Join our team of industry leaders at Scalian, where for over 30 years innovation and expertise come together. As a leading multinational engineering consultancy firm, we have over 5000 highly skilled specialists. Our focus on Digital Systems and Operational Performance, including IT, software and systems engineering, quality assurance, supply chain management, and project management, sets us apart in the industry.




Our expertise serves various technology sectors such as automotive, aerospace, medical, defense, rail and energy while providing distinctive support for their development and operations.




👉 Project Description




As an AI Research Engineer, you will leverage your expertise in language-based AI to develop a new system architecture, processes, and proof-of-concept for accurate chatbots, relevant to a wide range of industry partners. Experience with knowledge-based technologies (e.g., machine-readable ontologies) is a plus.




📌 Your Role:




Develop and test RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) pipelines for various data sources
Design agentic, knowledge-supported LLM (large language model) architectures for different stakeholders
Explore prompt engineering techniques to optimize chatbot accuracy
Lead and collaborate within the research team
Train and share knowledge with team members




👉 Your strengths




Master’s or PhD in AI, Machine Learning, LLM
Demonstrable experience in at least one relevant research or industry project
Strong motivation and passion for cutting-edge AI solutions
Research-oriented mindset with a focus on technology and industry impact
Knowledge in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, machine-readable ontologies, NLP models
Professional communication skills in Dutch & English




👉 What Scalian can offer you




We offer a competitive salary package and attractive extra-legal conditions (interesting bonus system, company car, hospitalization insurance, meal vouchers, eco-vouchers, etc.)
Scalian is a people-oriented company where values as community, teamwork and career management are key




Position to be filled on a permanent basis, based in Leuven.




Do you recognize yourself in this project summary? Do not hesitate to contact us and send us your CV!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Experience: 3+ Years

Location: Remote - anywhere with +4:30 hours difference from UTC +1 time zone

Time: Overlap of 4hrs minimum with German time 9am to 6pm.




Your Role & Responsibilities

Design & Develop: Build AI/ML platform, including algorithms for extracting structured and unstructured data from text and image documents, selecting models, developing training pipelines, managing feature stores, and creating scalable, high-performance data workflows.
Collaborate & Innovate: Work closely with the founding team to define the product vision, translate complex business requirements into AI/ML solutions, and integrate them seamlessly into user-facing products.
Hands-on Implementation: Lead technical tasks such as data preprocessing, model tuning, and deploying models into production environments.
Stay Ahead of Trends: Continuously explore and adopt emerging AI/ML technologies to enhance our capabilities and maintain a competitive edge.




What We’re Looking For

A degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
3+ years of hands-on experience developing and deploying AI/ML solutions in production environments.
Expertise in document understanding, computer vision, and NLP.
Experience in fine-tuning and deploying large language models (LLMs) for domain-specific applications.
Strong background in modern document extraction and AI/ML frameworks.
Experience in AI/ML applications for construction, industrial design, or CAD-related use cases, such as 2D to 3D floor plan conversion.
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Fluency in English (German is a plus).
